oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SGT Ammons with Vietnamese children from Qui Nhon

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ammons pictured with three Vietnamese children. He is on one knee, returning a baby to the arms of a little girl. Another child is partly visible on the left side of the image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Children; Military personnel; Soldiers; Uniforms; Military uniforms
Children; Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. Chris began his service as a replacement after the Tet Offensive and patrolled the Iron Triangle during his 1st tour. He briefly returned to the US in 1968 and was stationed at the armory at Fort Bragg. He returned to Vietnam as an MP in 1969.
